place.name: ABER NANT
place.gazetteerText: ABERNANT, a village and a parish in the district and county of Carmarthen. The village stands near the river Cywyn, 2¾ miles N of the South Wales railway, and 5 WNW of Carmarthen; and is a seat of petty sessions. Post Town, Carmarthen. The parish comprises 6,321 acres. Real property, £3,718. Pop., 793. Houses, 163. The property is subdivided. The living is a vicarage, united to the vicarage of Convil, in the diocese of St. David's. Value, £131.* Patron, the Duke of Leeds. The church is good. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
